column4: Hi all - I've a hardy box with intermittent network connection problems.  I changed the nic, cable, switchport but no luck.  No disconnection reported in dmesg. Any ideas?
I even went as far as changing the nic type...
what are the symptoms of the intermittent failure?

I can ping the box fine from the same lan.  Then randomly like every 10-30s it just drops.  The box was installed yesterday by a vendor for a 3rd party app.  When it drops the box itself can't ping anything
however the cisco switch interface never goes down
any interesting log entries from the problem machine during an episode?
No -  dmesg, messages, kern.log not showing anything interesting
and the interface remains configured during the episode, but can't even ping itself?
does ifconfig report a great deal of dropped packets?
also, could there be an ip address collision on the network?
ifconfig shows no errors.  No ip collision as I've used different IPs just in case.  Also checked arp on my switches - no issues
on a whim going to boot to earlier kernel...
no joy same in previous kernel.  Stumped
